sentence.Network_en: Her horse shied violently at a gorse bush.
sentence.Network_cn: 金雀花丛把她的马惊得猛然后退.

sentence.Network_en: Thoroughly drenched and chilled , the two adventurers returned to their position in the gorse.
sentence.Network_cn: 两个冒险家浑身湿漉漉地打着寒噤,回到原先金雀花丛那里.

sentence.Network_en: People say that when gorse is out of bloom, kissing is out of fashion.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们说,要是荆豆过了花期, 那接吻也就不合时尚了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gors, gorst, from an Indo-European root meaning 'rough, prickly', shared by German Gerste and Latin hordeum 'barley'

entry.def: Gorse is a dark green bush that grows in Europe. It has small yellow flowers and sharp prickles.

means.word_mean: 1. very spiny and dense evergreen shrub with fragrant golden-yellow flowers; common throughout western Europe

auth_sentence.content: Gorse bushes...emitted their strong coconut perfume.

auth_sentence.content: Bill Oddie goes cycling and walking on the heath among the gorse.
